content.en: GNSS signal optimization: A group of researchers have developed a set of new algorithms to improve the accuracy and efficiency of acquiring signals in Global Navigation Satellite Systems (GNSS). These algorithms aim to refine the estimation of Doppler frequency, reduce the number of required computations, improve the acquisition of signals with secondary codes, enhance the capturing speed of GPS receivers, and improve the accuracy of carrier frequency acquisition. By utilizing techniques such as Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) and Fractional Fourier Transform (FRFT), these algorithms offer promising solutions to enhance the performance of GNSS signal acquisition.
content.da: GNSS-signaloptimering: En gruppe forskere har udviklet et sæt nye algoritmer for at forbedre nøjagtigheden og effektiviteten af modtagelse af signaler i Global Navigation Satellite Systems (GNSS). Disse algoritmer har til formål at forfine estimatet af Doppler-frekvens, reducere antallet af nødvendige beregninger, forbedre modtagelsen af signaler med sekundære koder, øge hastigheden af GPS-modtageres signalfangst og forbedre nøjagtigheden af bærefrekvensmodtagelse. Ved at anvende teknikker som Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) og Fractional Fourier Transform (FRFT) tilbyder disse algoritmer lovende løsninger til at forbedre ydeevnen af GNSS-signalmodtagelse.
